Sentencas: High proton conductivity and good chemical stability are keys to development of new electrolytes for PC-SOFCs as the next-future energy generation systems.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: However, the extensive use of new polycrystalline materials as solid electrolytes is still avoided, since the grain boundary response usually leads to a decrease in total conductivity due to electrical blocking effect.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: Here, we present our results on the space-charge modeling of impedance spectroscopy data obtained for Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-delta proton conducting ceramics, where x = 0, 0.30 and R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+ are doping agents.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: Non-stoichiometric barium calcium niobate perovskites have received much attention as potential solid electrolytes for proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: We show that despite their increased grain conductivity, the doped ceramics possess Schottky barriers that are higher than those observed for undoped Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82O9-delta.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: In view of the space-charge model, proton depletion at the space-charge layer is the reason for the reduction of grain boundary conductivity in the doped compositions.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs

Sentencas: Our findings are important for the understanding of proton conduction mechanisms in polycrystalline materials, which may allow future optimization of new doped electrolytes based on barium calcium niobate perovskites.
Titulo: Blocking effect in promising proton conductors based on Ba3Ca1.18Nb1.82-xRxO9-δ (R = Y3+, Gd3+, Sm3+, Nd3+) ordered perovskites for PC-SOFCs
